contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox royalty|name=Uskhal Khan Tögüs Temür |title=[[Khagan]] of the [[Northern Yuan Dynasty|Great Yuan]] |image= YuanEmperorAlbumTögüsTemürUskhalPortrait.jpg |caption= |reign=May 1378 – November 1388 |coronation=May 1378 |full name=Mongolian: ᠲᠥᠭᠥᠰᠲᠥᠮᠥᠷ<br>Chinese: 脫古思帖木兒<br>Uskhal Khan Tögüs Temür |temple name=Yizong (益宗) |posthumous name=Ningxiao Huangdi (寧孝皇帝) |era dates=Xuanguang (宣光) 1378–1379<br>Tianyuan (天元) 1379–1388 |predecessor=[[Biligtü Khan]] |successor=[[Jorightu Khan]] |heir= |queen= |spouse= |spouse-type= |royal house=[[Borjigin]] |house=[[Northern Yuan Dynasty|Northern Yuan]] |house-type=Dynasty | royal anthem = |father=[[Toghun Temür]] |mother= |birth_date=1342<ref>Sh.Tseyen-Oidov – Chinggis bogdoos Ligden khutaghtu hurtel (khaad), p.129</ref> |death_date=November 1388 (aged 45–46) |death_place=[[Tuul River]], [[Mongolia]] |place of burial= |}} '''Uskhal Khan''' (''Төгс Төмөр хаан''), born '''Tögüs Temür''' ([[temple name]]: 益宗, Yizong; r. 1378–1388), was a [[Mongol]] Emperor of the [[Northern Yuan Dynasty]] in [[Mongolia]]. He was the last powerful khan of the Mongols until the reign of [[Dayan Khan]].<ref>Ed.Denis Crispin Twitchett, John King Fairbank-The Cambridge history of China, Volume 2; Volume 8, p.227</ref> Tögüs Temür was [[Biligtü Khan]]'s younger brother and son of [[Toghan Temur]], the last [[Yuan Dynasty|Yuan]] emperor in [[China]]. He succeeded to the throne with the title of Uskhal Khan (Урсхал хаан) after Biligtü Khan died in 1378. During the funeral of the late king, the Ming court sent an embassy to participate in it and released the Mongol prince, Maidarbal, who had been captured at the battle of Yingchang in 1378. Uskhal Khan Tögüs Temür mobilized troops near [[Yingchang]] and [[Karakorum]].<ref>L.Jamsran-Mongol ulsyin tuuh, vol>III, p.28</ref> He continued to press the [[Ming Dynasty|Ming]] from the north, cooperating with [[Nahachu]] of the [[Jalayir]] in [[Manchuria]]. The Ming launched a massive attack on [[Mongolia]] in return in 1380, sacking [[Karakorum]]. The Ming army crushed the Mongol garrison under Iliyasan in [[North China]] in June 1380. Uskhal Khan's commanders, Öljei-Buqa and Nair-Buqa, invaded Lulun city, killing the Ming officer Liu Guang in the same year. The Ming dispatched a large army against the Mongols the next year. [[Hongwu Emperor]] decided to exterminate Nahachu's force in Manchuria in 1387 and two sides suffered heavier losses at a battle near Changchung city. Tögüs Temür suddenly faced a predicament in 1387 when Nahachu surrendered to the Ming due to a devastating famine. The Ming now turned their attention to the Uskhal Khan Tögüs Temür who lived in Yingchang. In 1388 he was raided by the Ming on the [[Buir Lake]]. In his escape to Karakorum, he was suddenly attacked and defeated on the [[Tuul River]] by [[Jorightu Khan, Emperor Xingyuan of Northern Yuan|Yesüder]], a descendant of [[Ariq Böke]], who allied with the [[Oirats]].<ref>Reuven Amitai-Preiss, [[Reuven Amitai]], David Morgan-The Mongol empire and its legacy, p.293</ref> Yesüder's general killed the king and his son, though, Uskhal Khan intended to flee westwards to join his commander Markhas. This marked the decline of the [[Yuan Dynasty|Kublaid]] power and the rise of the Oirats in [[Mongolia]]. {{s-start}} {{s-hou|[[Borjigin|House of Borjigin]]||||1388}} {{s-reg|}} {{s-bef|before=[[Biligtü Khan Ayushiridara]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[Khan (title)|Khan]] of the [[Northern Yuan Dynasty]]|years=1378–1388}} {{s-aft|after=[[Jorightu Khan, Emperor Xingyuan of Northern Yuan|Jorightu Khan]]}} {{end}} ==References== {{reflist|2}} {{Northern Yuan Dynasty}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Uskhal Khan Togus Temur | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Yuan Dynasty emperor | DATE OF BIRTH = 1342 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = 1388 | PLACE OF DEATH = [[Tuul River]], [[Mongolia]] }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Temur, Togus, Uskhal Khan}} [[Category:1388 deaths]] [[Category:Yuan Dynasty emperors]] [[Category:14th-century Mongolian monarchs]] [[Category:1342 births]]
